Around 24 hours into using an iPad as my primary tablet and it's going well, although it's interesting that money had to be spent to get some basic functionality (an iPad doesn't make as good a bedside clock as an Android tablet, out of the box).
Might blog all of this soon.

After almost 5 years of service, it's time to retire my trusty Nexus 7. But... Given the rubbish state of the Android tablet market, I've decided the best replacement as my Google device is actually an iPad Mini 4.
@VolcanicArts @CaptainSparklez Yes.

After an epic road trip, @0rangelic and I are finally back in Scotland. Christmas dinner was bought from a service station and consumed on the A1.
Don't worry though, there's Port and cheese waiting for us in the kitchen.

Because..... why?!?
Have I mentioned I'm seriously hating Office 365/Outlook/etc? Utter junk.

Google Now has now learnt about the new subject I need to keep learning lots about. Here's the first story it's thrown at me. Fascinating too. https://t.co/O3gbHeGUTX

"The second part is a three-letter species code. For human, there is no species code so IDs are in the form ENS(object type)(identifier).(version)."
I mean, really, why would you do that? There's a species code, except for this particular species. Why? Doesn't quite make sense.

Reading up on Ensembl IDs and can't help but think they were badly designed https://t.co/2pAeP5zuTL
Not exactly straightforward to parse from code, which seems like an odd design decision.
Wondering if I'm missing a point/trick here.

That's it. Done my first full week working in an actual office, surrounded by actual people. I'm surprised at how much I'm enjoying it. The company, the people and the work have a lot to do with that.
Glad it's the weekend, but will actually miss going in tomorrow. This is good.

Curiosity: I have a bit of work-related hobby/pet-project C code. On work laptop (which is a damn fine machine), it’s estimating 4 days to run.
Testing it on my late 2013 iMac for LOLZ and stuff. It estimates it’ll run the same job in a touch over 2 days.
Genuinely surprised.

Working from home this morning. Did this for 21 years. And, yet, after just 6 weeks of working in an actual office... it feels odd! Actually miss the morning routine of driving in, getting breakfast and a coffee, settling into the desk, etc.
I wonder if the roof is accessible? That'd be worth dragging some camera gear into work for. https://t.co/W9GCLQ4Ce8

@VolcanicArts Languages don't provide that. Once you get that you'll have a whole new world to explore.
Get to know an editor well and then code lots of languages in it. See @code for example, if you like Visual Studio.
@VolcanicArts I mean try ruby the language, as something different from python. You might like it.
